title: Why Didn't Blackbeard Steal Magellan's Doku Doku no Mi?
author: One Piece Community (Multiple Contributors)
theoryText: After Blackbeard and his crew defeated Magellan in Impel Down (off-screen), they had the opportunity to steal Magellan's extremely powerful Doku Doku no Mi using Blackbeard's unique devil fruit stealing ability. However, they chose not to. This raises the question: why would Blackbeard pass up such a powerful fruit?
evidence: Blackbeard's crew defeated Magellan severely enough to get him demoted from Chief Warden to Vice Warden
Blackbeard demonstrated the ability to steal devil fruits later at Marineford with Whitebeard's Gura Gura no Mi
The Doku Doku no Mi is extremely powerful - Magellan defeated both Luffy and Blackbeard's entire crew with it
Blackbeard is known for strategic planning and seeking powerful abilities
proposedExplanations: Time constraints: Blackbeard was on a tight schedule to reach Marineford before the war ended and couldn't afford delays
Devil fruit stealing cooldown: Blackbeard may have limitations on how frequently he can steal fruits, and he was saving this ability for Whitebeard's more powerful Gura Gura no Mi
Fruit stealing mechanics: The fruit stealing process may require specific conditions (like a particular type of fruit nearby to absorb the devil) that weren't available for Magellan
Magellan wasn't killed: The devil fruit stealing ability may only work on deceased users, and Blackbeard chose to spare Magellan
popularity: High - frequently discussed in community forums
canonStatus: The mechanism of Blackbeard's fruit stealing remains unexplained in canon
communityReception: Widely debated with no consensus. Popular theory that there are limitations or cooldowns on Blackbeard's ability.

title: Magellan Could Have Been an Admiral
author: One Piece Community
theoryText: Magellan's power level is comparable to Marine Admirals - he single-handedly defeated future Emperor Blackbeard and his entire crew, as well as Luffy. The theory questions why such a powerful character remains at Impel Down rather than becoming an Admiral. Some fans theorize his chronic diarrhea and the nature of his poison powers (which could harm allies) make him unsuitable for frontline combat.
evidence: Defeated Luffy completely in their first encounter
Defeated the entire Blackbeard Pirates crew
Nearly stopped the entire Impel Down mass breakout single-handedly with Venom Demon
His Doku Doku no Mi is one of the most lethal Devil Fruits shown in the series
Venom Demon technique is powerful enough to destroy all of Impel Down
proposedExplanations: His chronic diarrhea limits his operational effectiveness to 4 hours per day
His poison powers are too indiscriminate and would harm allies in large-scale battles
He may prefer the structured environment of Impel Down to active combat duty
The World Government needs someone of his caliber to guard the world's most dangerous criminals
His failure to stop the mass breakout damaged his reputation too much for promotion
popularity: Moderate - discussed when comparing power levels
canonStatus: Canon establishes Magellan's strength but doesn't address why he isn't an Admiral
communityReception: Generally accepted that Magellan has Admiral-level strength, with debate on why he's stationed at Impel Down

title: The Impel Down Escape Was Inevitable Due to Government Overconfidence
author: One Piece Community Analysts
theoryText: Some fans theorize that the Impel Down mass breakout was inevitable due to the World Government's overconfidence in their 'inescapable' prison. By relying too heavily on Magellan as a single point of failure and underestimating the power of cooperation among prisoners, the system had a critical weakness. The escape in Episode 450 represents the consequences of institutional arrogance.
evidence: The entire security system relied heavily on one person (Magellan)
Level 5.5 existed for years without the government knowing
The prison had never experienced a breakout attempt of this scale
Multiple powerful prisoners (Crocodile, Jinbe, Ivankov) were kept in proximity
The coordination between Luffy's allies (Ivankov's Hell Wink, Jinbe's whale sharks, Mr. 3's wax) showed teamwork could overcome individual strength
proposedExplanations: The World Government's hubris made them complacent about security improvements
Keeping all the world's most dangerous criminals in one location created a concentration of power that could be exploited
The rigid hierarchy prevented adaptive responses to unprecedented situations
Magellan's personal sense of duty couldn't compensate for systemic vulnerabilities
canonStatus: Canon supports this through narrative themes about institutional failure
communityReception: Well-received as thematic analysis of the arc's message about freedom vs. control
